contentencoded:
Twitter has gone public with its plans to go public. We learn more details about the company as it has made public its papers for an S-1 Initial Public Offering.

Justin Timberlake is an unlikely casino industry spokesman, but the American Gaming Association is using his new movie "Runner Runner" to lobby for more regulation on Internet gambling.

As the fight over the nation's budget continues, we pose the question: Is Congress smarter than a seventh grader?
itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Friday, October 4, 2013
teaser: More details emerge about Twitter as the company made public its papers for an S-1 IPO. The American Gaming Association is pushing for more gambling regulation. And when it comes to our government's problems, should we turn it over to the kids?
title: PODCAST: Is Congress smarter than a 7th grader?
description: More details emerge about Twitter as the company made public its papers for an S-1 IPO. The American Gaming Association is pushing for more gambling regulation. And when it comes to our government's problems, should we turn it over to the kids?
